trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>Create Virtual Machine Deployment</languageKeyword> operation creates a deployment and then creates a Virtual Machine in the deployment based on the specified configuration.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>Create Virtual Machine Deployment</languageKeyword> operation creates a deployment and then creates a Virtual Machine in the deployment based on the specified configuration.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>Create Virtual Machine Deployment</languageKeyword> request may be specified as follows.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>Create Virtual Machine Deployment</languageKeyword> request may be specified as follows.

trans-unit.source: Replace <codeInline>%%amp;lt;subscription-id%%amp;gt;</codeInline> with the subscription ID and <codeInline>%%amp;lt;cloudservice-name%%amp;gt;</codeInline> with the name of the cloud service.
trans-unit.target: Replace <codeInline>%%amp;lt;subscription-id%%amp;gt;</codeInline> with the subscription ID and <codeInline>%%amp;lt;cloudservice-name%%amp;gt;</codeInline> with the name of the cloud service.

trans-unit.source: You must make sure that the request that is made to the management service is secure.
trans-unit.target: You must make sure that the request that is made to the management service is secure.

trans-unit.source: For additional details, see <link xlink:href="1becb7dc-1cdc-4db4-8ae8-7e351c96c251" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Authenticating Service Management Requests</link>.
trans-unit.target: For additional details, see <link xlink:href="1becb7dc-1cdc-4db4-8ae8-7e351c96c251" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Authenticating Service Management Requests</link>.

trans-unit.source: The following table describes the request headers.
trans-unit.target: The following table describes the request headers.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the version of the operation to use for this request.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the version of the operation to use for this request.

trans-unit.source: This header should be set to <userInput>2012-03-01</userInput> or higher.
trans-unit.target: This header should be set to <userInput>2012-03-01</userInput> or higher.

trans-unit.source: For more information about versioning headers, see <externalLink><linkText>Service Management Versioning</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windowsazure/gg592580.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about versioning headers, see <externalLink><linkText>Service Management Versioning</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windowsazure/gg592580.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: The format of the request body is as follows:
trans-unit.target: The format of the request body is as follows:

trans-unit.source: The following table describes the elements of the request body.
trans-unit.target: The following table describes the elements of the request body.

trans-unit.source: Specifies a name for the deployment.
trans-unit.target: Specifies a name for the deployment.

trans-unit.source: The deployment name must be unique among other deployments for the cloud service.
trans-unit.target: The deployment name must be unique among other deployments for the cloud service.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the environment in which the Virtual Machine is to be deployed.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the environment in which the Virtual Machine is to be deployed.

trans-unit.source: Specifies an identifier for the deployment.
trans-unit.target: Specifies an identifier for the deployment.

trans-unit.source: The label can be up to 100 characters long.
trans-unit.target: The label can be up to 100 characters long.

trans-unit.source: The label can be used for tracking purposes.
trans-unit.target: The label can be used for tracking purposes.

trans-unit.source: Contains information about the Virtual Machine that is deployed.
trans-unit.target: Contains information about the Virtual Machine that is deployed.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the name of an existing virtual network to which the deployment will belong.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the name of an existing virtual network to which the deployment will belong.

trans-unit.source: Virtual networks are created by calling the <link xlink:href="3b490f31-100f-4d58-a8b2-42a7df1ea921" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">SetNetworkConfiguration</link> operation.
trans-unit.target: Virtual networks are created by calling the <link xlink:href="3b490f31-100f-4d58-a8b2-42a7df1ea921" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">SetNetworkConfiguration</link> operation.

trans-unit.source: Contains a list of DNS servers to associate with the Virtual Machine.
trans-unit.target: Contains a list of DNS servers to associate with the Virtual Machine.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the name of a reserved IP address that is to be assigned to the deployment.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the name of a reserved IP address that is to be assigned to the deployment.

trans-unit.source: You must run <link xlink:href="685bfe6e-45d6-418d-8051-5f31f2269f0a" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Create Reserved IP Address</link> before you can assign the address to the deployment using this element.
trans-unit.target: You must run <link xlink:href="685bfe6e-45d6-418d-8051-5f31f2269f0a" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Create Reserved IP Address</link> before you can assign the address to the deployment using this element.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>ReservedIPName</languageKeyword> element is only available using version 2014-05-01 or higher.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>ReservedIPName</languageKeyword> element is only available using version 2014-05-01 or higher.

trans-unit.source: Contains a list of internal load balancers that can be assigned to input endpoints.
trans-unit.target: Contains a list of internal load balancers that can be assigned to input endpoints.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>LoadBalancers</languageKeyword> element is only available using version 2014-05-01 or higher.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>LoadBalancers</languageKeyword> element is only available using version 2014-05-01 or higher.

trans-unit.source: Contains information about the Virtual Machine that is deployed.
trans-unit.target: Contains information about the Virtual Machine that is deployed.

trans-unit.source: Contains the configuration sets that are used to create a Virtual Machine.
trans-unit.target: Contains the configuration sets that are used to create a Virtual Machine.

trans-unit.source: Contains the configuration sets that are used to create a Virtual Machine.
trans-unit.target: Contains the configuration sets that are used to create a Virtual Machine.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the name for the Virtual Machine.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the name for the Virtual Machine.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the type of role to use.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the type of role to use.

trans-unit.source: For Virtual Machines, this must be <languageKeyword>PersistentVMRole</languageKeyword>.
trans-unit.target: For Virtual Machines, this must be <languageKeyword>PersistentVMRole</languageKeyword>.

trans-unit.source: Contains a collection of configuration sets that define system and application settings.
trans-unit.target: Contains a collection of configuration sets that define system and application settings.

trans-unit.source: Contains a collection of resource extensions that are to be installed on the Virtual Machine.
trans-unit.target: Contains a collection of resource extensions that are to be installed on the Virtual Machine.

trans-unit.source: This element is used if ProvisionGuestAgent is set to <languageKeyword>true</languageKeyword>.
trans-unit.target: This element is used if ProvisionGuestAgent is set to <languageKeyword>true</languageKeyword>.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>ResourceExtensionReferences</languageKeyword> element is only available using version 2013-11-01 or higher.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>ResourceExtensionReferences</languageKeyword> element is only available using version 2013-11-01 or higher.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the name of the VM Image that is to be used to create the Virtual Machine.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the name of the VM Image that is to be used to create the Virtual Machine.

trans-unit.source: If this element is used, the <languageKeyword>ConfigurationSets</languageKeyword> element is not used.
trans-unit.target: If this element is used, the <languageKeyword>ConfigurationSets</languageKeyword> element is not used.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="1c83a88d-85af-47cf-9d17-ef7a7e3e2a39" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Capture VM Image</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="1c83a88d-85af-47cf-9d17-ef7a7e3e2a39" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Capture VM Image</link>.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>VMImageName</languageKeyword> element is only available using version 2014-02-01 or higher.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>VMImageName</languageKeyword> element is only available using version 2014-02-01 or higher.

trans-unit.source: Required if the Virtual Machine is being created from a published VM Image.
trans-unit.target: Required if the Virtual Machine is being created from a published VM Image.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the location of the VHD file that is created when VMImageName specifies a published VM Image.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the location of the VHD file that is created when VMImageName specifies a published VM Image.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>MediaLocation</languageKeyword> element is only available using version 2014-05-01 or higher.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>MediaLocation</languageKeyword> element is only available using version 2014-05-01 or higher.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the name of a collection of Virtual Machines.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the name of a collection of Virtual Machines.

trans-unit.source: Virtual Machines specified in the same availability set are allocated to different nodes to maximize availability.
trans-unit.target: Virtual Machines specified in the same availability set are allocated to different nodes to maximize availability.

trans-unit.source: Contains the parameters that are used to add a data disk to a Virtual Machine.
trans-unit.target: Contains the parameters that are used to add a data disk to a Virtual Machine.

trans-unit.source: If you are creating a Virtual Machine by using a VM Image, this element is not used.
trans-unit.target: If you are creating a Virtual Machine by using a VM Image, this element is not used.

trans-unit.source: For more information about data disks, see <externalLink><linkText>Manage Disks and Images</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windowsazure/jj672979.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about data disks, see <externalLink><linkText>Manage Disks and Images</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windowsazure/jj672979.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: Contains the parameters that are used to create the operating system disk for a Virtual Machine.
trans-unit.target: Contains the parameters that are used to create the operating system disk for a Virtual Machine.

trans-unit.source: If you are creating a Virtual Machine by using a VM Image, this element is not used.
trans-unit.target: If you are creating a Virtual Machine by using a VM Image, this element is not used.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the size of the Virtual Machine.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the size of the Virtual Machine.

trans-unit.source: For more information about Virtual Machine sizes, see <externalLink><linkText>Virtual Machine and Cloud Service Sizes for Azure</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windowsazure/dn197896.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about Virtual Machine sizes, see <externalLink><linkText>Virtual Machine and Cloud Service Sizes for Azure</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windowsazure/dn197896.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: Indicates whether the VM Agent is installed on the Virtual Machine.
trans-unit.target: Indicates whether the VM Agent is installed on the Virtual Machine.

trans-unit.source: To run a resource extension in a Virtual Machine, this service must be installed.
trans-unit.target: To run a resource extension in a Virtual Machine, this service must be installed.

trans-unit.source: Specifies a new size for the disks in a VM Image.
trans-unit.target: Specifies a new size for the disks in a VM Image.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>VMImageInput</languageKeyword> element is only available using version 2014-10-01 or higher.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>VMImageInput</languageKeyword> element is only available using version 2014-10-01 or higher.

trans-unit.source: Contains a collection of configuration sets that specify system and application configuration settings.
trans-unit.target: Contains a collection of configuration sets that specify system and application configuration settings.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the configuration elements of the Virtual Machine.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the configuration elements of the Virtual Machine.

trans-unit.source: The type attribute is required to prevent the administrator password from being written to the operation history file.
trans-unit.target: The type attribute is required to prevent the administrator password from being written to the operation history file.

trans-unit.source: To create a Virtual Machine, you must specify one of the following configuration sets:
trans-unit.target: To create a Virtual Machine, you must specify one of the following configuration sets:

trans-unit.source: You can optionally specify a <languageKeyword>NetworkConfiguration</languageKeyword> set that contains the metadata required to create the virtual network configuration for a Virtual Machine.
trans-unit.target: You can optionally specify a <languageKeyword>NetworkConfiguration</languageKeyword> set that contains the metadata required to create the virtual network configuration for a Virtual Machine.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the computer name for the Virtual Machine.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the computer name for the Virtual Machine.

trans-unit.source: If you do not specify a computer name, one is assigned that is a combination of the deployment name, role name, and identifying number.
trans-unit.target: If you do not specify a computer name, one is assigned that is a combination of the deployment name, role name, and identifying number.

trans-unit.source: Computer names must be 1 to 15 characters long.
trans-unit.target: Computer names must be 1 to 15 characters long.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the password to use for an administrator account on the Virtual Machine that is being created.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the password to use for an administrator account on the Virtual Machine that is being created.

trans-unit.source: If you are creating a Virtual Machine using an image, you must specify a name of an administrator account to be created on the machine using the <languageKeyword>AdminUsername</languageKeyword> element.
trans-unit.target: If you are creating a Virtual Machine using an image, you must specify a name of an administrator account to be created on the machine using the <languageKeyword>AdminUsername</languageKeyword> element.

trans-unit.source: You must use the <languageKeyword>AdminPassword</languageKeyword> element to specify the password of the administrator account that is being created.
trans-unit.target: You must use the <languageKeyword>AdminPassword</languageKeyword> element to specify the password of the administrator account that is being created.

trans-unit.source: If you are creating a Virtual Machine using an existing specialized disk, this element is not used because the account should already exist on the disk.
trans-unit.target: If you are creating a Virtual Machine using an existing specialized disk, this element is not used because the account should already exist on the disk.

trans-unit.source: Specifies whether automatic updates are enabled for the Virtual Machine.
trans-unit.target: Specifies whether automatic updates are enabled for the Virtual Machine.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the time zone for the Virtual Machine.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the time zone for the Virtual Machine.

trans-unit.source: For a complete list of supported time zone entries, you can:
trans-unit.target: For a complete list of supported time zone entries, you can:

trans-unit.source: Refer to the values listed in the registry entry <codeEntityReference>HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Time Zones</codeEntityReference>.
trans-unit.target: Refer to the values listed in the registry entry <codeEntityReference>HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Time Zones</codeEntityReference>.

trans-unit.source: You can use the tzutil command-line tool to list the valid time.
trans-unit.target: You can use the tzutil command-line tool to list the valid time.

trans-unit.source: Contains properties that define a domain to which the Virtual Machine will be joined.
trans-unit.target: Contains properties that define a domain to which the Virtual Machine will be joined.

trans-unit.source: Contains a list of service certificates with which to provision to the new Virtual Machine.
trans-unit.target: Contains a list of service certificates with which to provision to the new Virtual Machine.

trans-unit.source: Contains configuration settings for the Windows Remote Management service on the Virtual Machine.
trans-unit.target: Contains configuration settings for the Windows Remote Management service on the Virtual Machine.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>WinRM</languageKeyword> element is only available using version 2013-03-01 or higher.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>WinRM</languageKeyword> element is only available using version 2013-03-01 or higher.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the name of the administrator account that is created to access the Virtual Machine.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the name of the administrator account that is created to access the Virtual Machine.

trans-unit.source: If you are creating a Virtual Machine using an image, you must specify a name of an administrator account to be created by using this element.
trans-unit.target: If you are creating a Virtual Machine using an image, you must specify a name of an administrator account to be created by using this element.

trans-unit.source: You must use the <languageKeyword>AdminPassword</languageKeyword> element to specify the password of the administrator account that is being created.
trans-unit.target: You must use the <languageKeyword>AdminPassword</languageKeyword> element to specify the password of the administrator account that is being created.

trans-unit.source: If you are creating a Virtual Machine using an existing specialized disk, this element is not used because the account should already exist on the disk.
trans-unit.target: If you are creating a Virtual Machine using an existing specialized disk, this element is not used because the account should already exist on the disk.

trans-unit.source: Specifies a base-64 encoded string of custom data.
trans-unit.target: Specifies a base-64 encoded string of custom data.

trans-unit.source: The base-64 encoded string is decoded to a binary array that is saved as a file on the Virtual Machine.
trans-unit.target: The base-64 encoded string is decoded to a binary array that is saved as a file on the Virtual Machine.

trans-unit.source: The maximum length of the binary array is 65535 bytes.
trans-unit.target: The maximum length of the binary array is 65535 bytes.

trans-unit.source: If the file exists, it is overwritten.
trans-unit.target: If the file exists, it is overwritten.

trans-unit.source: The security on directory is set to System:Full Control and Administrators:Full Control.
trans-unit.target: The security on directory is set to System:Full Control and Administrators:Full Control.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>CustomData</languageKeyword> element is only available using version 2013-10-01 or higher.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>CustomData</languageKeyword> element is only available using version 2013-10-01 or higher.

trans-unit.source: Specifies additional base-64 encoded XML formatted information that can be included in the Unattend.xml file, which is used by Windows Setup.
trans-unit.target: Specifies additional base-64 encoded XML formatted information that can be included in the Unattend.xml file, which is used by Windows Setup.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>AdditionalUnattendContent</languageKeyword> element is only available using version 2014-04-01 or higher.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>AdditionalUnattendContent</languageKeyword> element is only available using version 2014-04-01 or higher.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the host name for the Virtual Machine.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the host name for the Virtual Machine.

trans-unit.source: Host names must be 1 to 64 characters long.
trans-unit.target: Host names must be 1 to 64 characters long.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the name of a user account to be created in the sudoer group of the Virtual Machine.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the name of a user account to be created in the sudoer group of the Virtual Machine.

trans-unit.source: User account names must be 1 to 32 characters long.
trans-unit.target: User account names must be 1 to 32 characters long.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the password for the user account.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the password for the user account.

trans-unit.source: Passwords must be 6 to 72 characters long.
trans-unit.target: Passwords must be 6 to 72 characters long.

trans-unit.source: Specifies whether SSH password authentication is disabled.
trans-unit.target: Specifies whether SSH password authentication is disabled.

trans-unit.source: By default this value is set to true.
trans-unit.target: By default this value is set to true.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the SSH public keys and key pairs to use with the Virtual Machine.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the SSH public keys and key pairs to use with the Virtual Machine.

trans-unit.source: Specifies a base-64 encoded string of custom data.
trans-unit.target: Specifies a base-64 encoded string of custom data.

trans-unit.source: The base-64 encoded string is located in the ovf-env.xml file on the ISO of the Virtual Machine.
trans-unit.target: The base-64 encoded string is located in the ovf-env.xml file on the ISO of the Virtual Machine.

trans-unit.source: The file is copied to /var/lib/waagent/ovf-env.xml by the Azure Linux Agent.
trans-unit.target: The file is copied to /var/lib/waagent/ovf-env.xml by the Azure Linux Agent.

trans-unit.source: The Azure Linux Agent will also place the base-64 encoded data in /var/lib/waagent/CustomData during provisioning.
trans-unit.target: The Azure Linux Agent will also place the base-64 encoded data in /var/lib/waagent/CustomData during provisioning.

trans-unit.source: The maximum length of the binary array is 65535 bytes.
trans-unit.target: The maximum length of the binary array is 65535 bytes.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>CustomData</languageKeyword> element is only available using version 2013-10-01 or higher.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>CustomData</languageKeyword> element is only available using version 2013-10-01 or higher.

trans-unit.source: Contains a collection of external endpoints for the Virtual Machine.
trans-unit.target: Contains a collection of external endpoints for the Virtual Machine.

trans-unit.source: Required if <languageKeyword>StaticVirtualNetworkIPAddress</languageKeyword> is specified; otherwise, optional in NetworkConfiguration.
trans-unit.target: Required if <languageKeyword>StaticVirtualNetworkIPAddress</languageKeyword> is specified; otherwise, optional in NetworkConfiguration.

trans-unit.source: Contains a list of subnets to which the Virtual Machine will belong.
trans-unit.target: Contains a list of subnets to which the Virtual Machine will belong.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the internal IP address for the Virtual Machine in a Virtual Network.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the internal IP address for the Virtual Machine in a Virtual Network.

trans-unit.source: If you specify this element, you must also specify the <link xlink:href="9668f1a3-0e73-4c8d-9069-a8bebaa73e70#SubnetNames" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">SubnetNames</link> element with only one subnet defined.
trans-unit.target: If you specify this element, you must also specify the <link xlink:href="9668f1a3-0e73-4c8d-9069-a8bebaa73e70#SubnetNames" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">SubnetNames</link> element with only one subnet defined.

trans-unit.source: The IP address specified in this element must belong to the subnet that is defined in <link xlink:href="9668f1a3-0e73-4c8d-9069-a8bebaa73e70#SubnetNames" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">SubnetNames</link> and it should not be the one of the first four IP addresses or the last IP address in the subnet.
trans-unit.target: The IP address specified in this element must belong to the subnet that is defined in <link xlink:href="9668f1a3-0e73-4c8d-9069-a8bebaa73e70#SubnetNames" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">SubnetNames</link> and it should not be the one of the first four IP addresses or the last IP address in the subnet.

trans-unit.source: Deploying web roles or worker roles into a subnet that has Virtual Machines with StaticVirtualNetworkIPAddress defined is not supported.
trans-unit.target: Deploying web roles or worker roles into a subnet that has Virtual Machines with StaticVirtualNetworkIPAddress defined is not supported.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>StaticVirtualNetworkIPAddress</languageKeyword> element is only available using version 2013-11-01 or higher.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>StaticVirtualNetworkIPAddress</languageKeyword> element is only available using version 2013-11-01 or higher.

trans-unit.source: Contains a public IP address that can be used in addition to the default virtual IP address for the Virtual Machine.
trans-unit.target: Contains a public IP address that can be used in addition to the default virtual IP address for the Virtual Machine.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>PublicIPs</languageKeyword> element is only available using version 2014-05-01 or higher.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>PublicIPs</languageKeyword> element is only available using version 2014-05-01 or higher.

trans-unit.source: A set of secondary network interfaces.
trans-unit.target: A set of secondary network interfaces.

trans-unit.source: The number of secondary network interfaces allowed depends on the size of the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: The number of secondary network interfaces allowed depends on the size of the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>NetworkInterfaces</languageKeyword> element is only available using version 2014-08-01 or higher.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>NetworkInterfaces</languageKeyword> element is only available using version 2014-08-01 or higher.

trans-unit.source: Contains properties that define a domain to which the Virtual Machine will be joined.
trans-unit.target: Contains properties that define a domain to which the Virtual Machine will be joined.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the credentials to use to join the Virtual Machine to the domain.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the credentials to use to join the Virtual Machine to the domain.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) X 500-distinguished name of the organizational unit (OU) in which the computer account is created.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) X 500-distinguished name of the organizational unit (OU) in which the computer account is created.

trans-unit.source: This account is in Active Directory on a domain controller in the domain to which the computer is being joined.
trans-unit.target: This account is in Active Directory on a domain controller in the domain to which the computer is being joined.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the credentials to use to join the Virtual Machine to the domain.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the credentials to use to join the Virtual Machine to the domain.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the name of the domain used to authenticate an account.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the name of the domain used to authenticate an account.

trans-unit.source: The value is a fully qualified DNS domain.
trans-unit.target: The value is a fully qualified DNS domain.

trans-unit.source: If the domains name is not specified, <languageKeyword>Username</languageKeyword> must specify the user principal name (UPN) format (user@fully-qualified-DNS-domain) or the fully-qualified-DNS-domain\username format.
trans-unit.target: If the domains name is not specified, <languageKeyword>Username</languageKeyword> must specify the user principal name (UPN) format (user@fully-qualified-DNS-domain) or the fully-qualified-DNS-domain\username format.

trans-unit.source: Specifies a user name in the domain that can be used to join the domain.
trans-unit.target: Specifies a user name in the domain that can be used to join the domain.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the password to use to join the domain.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the password to use to join the domain.

trans-unit.source: Contains a list of service certificates with which to provision to the new Virtual Machine.
trans-unit.target: Contains a list of service certificates with which to provision to the new Virtual Machine.

trans-unit.source: Stored certificate settings reference certificates that already exist in the cloud service.
trans-unit.target: Stored certificate settings reference certificates that already exist in the cloud service.

trans-unit.source: Before you configure the stored certificates for the Virtual Machine, you must call the <link xlink:href="eb4313c8-19b7-4966-912b-eced07a0e36e" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Add Service Certificate</link> operation or add the certificate by using the Management portal.
trans-unit.target: Before you configure the stored certificates for the Virtual Machine, you must call the <link xlink:href="eb4313c8-19b7-4966-912b-eced07a0e36e" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Add Service Certificate</link> operation or add the certificate by using the Management portal.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the parameters for the certificate.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the parameters for the certificate.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the certificate store location on the Virtual Machine.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the certificate store location on the Virtual Machine.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the name of the certificate store from which the certificate is retrieved.

trans-unit.source: Contains a collection of resource extensions that are to be installed on the Virtual Machine.

trans-unit.target: A resource extension is a software component that is installed on the Virtual Machine.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the version of the resource extension.

trans-unit.source: You can set this value to <languageKeyword>*</languageKeyword> to use the latest version of the extension.
trans-unit.target: You can set this value to <languageKeyword>*</languageKeyword> to use the latest version of the extension.

trans-unit.source: If the extension has been recently added or updated, you must make sure that the value of <languageKeyword>ReplicationCompleted</languageKeyword> is set to <languageKeyword>true</languageKeyword> before you can use the version of the extension.
trans-unit.target: If the extension has been recently added or updated, you must make sure that the value of <languageKeyword>ReplicationCompleted</languageKeyword> is set to <languageKeyword>true</languageKeyword> before you can use the version of the extension.

trans-unit.source: If the configuration of the extension is formatted in XML, this value is validated by using the public or private schema.
trans-unit.target: If the configuration of the extension is formatted in XML, this value is validated by using the public or private schema.

trans-unit.source: The schema that is used depends on the value of <languageKeyword>Type</languageKeyword>.
trans-unit.target: The schema that is used depends on the value of <languageKeyword>Type</languageKeyword>.

trans-unit.source: If the configuration of the extension is formatted in JSON, this value must contain a valid JSON object.
trans-unit.target: If the configuration of the extension is formatted in JSON, this value must contain a valid JSON object.

trans-unit.source: The public or private schemas cannot be used to validate the object.
trans-unit.target: The public or private schemas cannot be used to validate the object.

trans-unit.source: When you create a deployment of a Virtual Machine, you should make sure that the cloud service and the disk or image that you use are located in the same region.
trans-unit.target: When you create a deployment of a Virtual Machine, you should make sure that the cloud service and the disk or image that you use are located in the same region.

trans-unit.source: For example, if the cloud service was created in the <languageKeyword>West US</languageKeyword> region, the disk or image that you use should also be located in a storage account in the <languageKeyword>West US</languageKeyword> region.
trans-unit.target: For example, if the cloud service was created in the <languageKeyword>West US</languageKeyword> region, the disk or image that you use should also be located in a storage account in the <languageKeyword>West US</languageKeyword> region.

trans-unit.source: To run this example, replace the values of the following variables:
trans-unit.target: To run this example, replace the values of the following variables:

trans-unit.source: Provide a thumbprint of a management certificate that has been uploaded to authorize operations to perform in Azure.
trans-unit.target: Provide a thumbprint of a management certificate that has been uploaded to authorize operations to perform in Azure.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <externalLink><linkText>Create and Upload a Management Certificate for Azure</linkText><linkUri>http://msdnstage.redmond.corp.microsoft.com/library/gg551722.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <externalLink><linkText>Create and Upload a Management Certificate for Azure</linkText><linkUri>http://msdnstage.redmond.corp.microsoft.com/library/gg551722.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: Provide the subscription identifier that is needed to find the appropriate cloud service.
trans-unit.target: Provide the subscription identifier that is needed to find the appropriate cloud service.

trans-unit.source: To find the subscription identifier, click <ui>Settings</ui> in the Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: To find the subscription identifier, click <ui>Settings</ui> in the Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: Provide the name of the existing cloud service to which you want to deploy the Virtual Machine.
trans-unit.target: Provide the name of the existing cloud service to which you want to deploy the Virtual Machine.

trans-unit.source: You can use <externalLink><linkText>List Cloud Services</linkText><linkUri>http://msdnstage.redmond.corp.microsoft.com/library/ee460781.aspx</linkUri></externalLink> to find the names of existing services.
trans-unit.target: You can use <externalLink><linkText>List Cloud Services</linkText><linkUri>http://msdnstage.redmond.corp.microsoft.com/library/ee460781.aspx</linkUri></externalLink> to find the names of existing services.

trans-unit.source: You can create a cloud service by using the Management Portal, by using <externalLink><linkText>Create Cloud Service</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/gg441304.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>, or by using the <externalLink><linkText>New-AzureService</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/jj152889.aspx</linkUri></externalLink> cmdlet.
trans-unit.target: You can create a cloud service by using the Management Portal, by using <externalLink><linkText>Create Cloud Service</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/gg441304.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>, or by using the <externalLink><linkText>New-AzureService</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/jj152889.aspx</linkUri></externalLink> cmdlet.

trans-unit.source: Provide a name for the new deployment.
trans-unit.target: Provide a name for the new deployment.

trans-unit.source: Provide an identifier for the deployment.
trans-unit.target: Provide an identifier for the deployment.

trans-unit.source: This label can be used for tracking purposes.
trans-unit.target: This label can be used for tracking purposes.

trans-unit.source: Provide a name for the administrator account on the Virtual Machine.
trans-unit.target: Provide a name for the administrator account on the Virtual Machine.

trans-unit.source: Provide a name for the role.
trans-unit.target: Provide a name for the role.

trans-unit.source: In this example, the role name is also used as the computer name.
trans-unit.target: In this example, the role name is also used as the computer name.

trans-unit.source: Provide the name of the platform image that you want to use to provision the Virtual Machine.
trans-unit.target: Provide the name of the platform image that you want to use to provision the Virtual Machine.

trans-unit.source: You can use <externalLink><linkText>List OS Images</linkText><linkUri>http://msdnstage.redmond.corp.microsoft.com/library/jj157191.aspx</linkUri></externalLink> to obtain the names of available platform images in the image repository.
